FM501.name: Preceptorship Training
FM501.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

FM580.name: Special Topics in Family Medicine
FM580.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM580.description: Exploration of special aspects of family practice. Examples include ethnicity and aging, clinical nutrition, sports medicine, death and dying, health care of women, research methods in primary care.
FM580.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or in the College of Human Medicine.

FM608.name: Family Practice Clerkship
FM608.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM608.description: Clinical experience in primary care in family physicians offices and in hospitals.
FM608.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

FM610.name: Outpatient Family Medicine Clerkship
FM610.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM610.description: Skills and knowledge in interviewing, clinical procedures, diagnosis, use of community resource utilization, and health maintenance in the outpatient healthcare setting.
FM610.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

FM611.name: Geriatric Clerkship
FM611.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM611.description: Diagnosis, treatment, interdisciplinary team evaluation in geriatric medicine. Advanced care directive processes and procedures.
FM611.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

FM612.name: Inpatient Family Medicine Clerkship
FM612.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM612.description: Skills and knowledge in interviewing, clinical procedures, diagnosis, interdisciplinary evaluation, and use of community resources in the inpatient healthcare setting.
FM612.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

FM613.name: Clinical Research in Family Practice
FM613.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM613.description: Investigation of clinical research topics in family practice. Application of survey and epidemiologic research methods. Use of clinical data.
FM613.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

FM614.name: Breastfeeding and Lactation (Interim New)
FM614.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM614.description: Skills and knowledge necessary to advise and assist breastfeeding infants and their mothers including management of common difficulties.
FM614.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

FM616.name: Rural Family Practice Elective
FM616.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM616.description: Clerkship in the unique issues and medical care of residents in rural communities. Emphasis of the clerkship is on patient care management by the family physician.
FM616.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

FM617.name: Sports Medicine Clerkship
FM617.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM617.description: Evaluation and treatment of acute and chronic sports injuries in the primary care setting. Acute and emergency care, transportation, and rehabilitation training for collegiate and/or local community athletes. Interdisciplinary care and consultation of athletes, Philosophy and basic science of sports medicine care.
FM617.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

FM618.name: Palliative and End of Life Care Clerkship
FM618.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM618.description: Basic knowledge and skills necessary to manage patients and families faced with end of life illnesses.
FM618.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

FM620.name: Family Practice Subinternship
FM620.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM620.description: Care and management of patients in a family physician's office in a medically underserved community. Required project on integration of population based medicine into routine clinical care.
FM620.prerequisite: FM 608 and PHD 600 and MED 608 and PSC 608 and OGR 608 and SUR 608

FM633.name: Extended Clinical Experience
FM633.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM633.description: Based in community hospitals and ambulatory sites. Emphasizes interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy.
FM633.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Human Medicine.

FM641.name: Family Medicine Clerkship in the Late Clinical Experience
FM641.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM641.description: Clinical experience in which students take primary responsibility for managing the care of patients in a primary care setting under the supervision of attending physicians.
FM641.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

FM644.name: Family Medicine Clerkship in the Late Clinical Experience Remediation
FM644.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FM644.description: Interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy in community hospitals and/or ambulatory sites.
FM644.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.
